p: The leaf carbon concentration (LCC) of the plant was significantly influenced by N and Tsp, the leaf nitrogen concentration (LNC) by N, Light, Tsp and Culture, and the leaf carbon-nitrogen ratio (C:N) by N, Light and Tsp (Table 2, and see Supplementary Figs S4– S6). In general, nitrogen addition increased the LCC and LNC but decreased the C:N of the plants. There were significant interactive effects between N and Tsp on LNC and C:N (except for LCC). The LNCs of both the invader and the native species were significantly increased by nitrogen treatment (Fig. 4b). The C:N of the invasive plant was not significantly changed by nitrogen treatment, while those of the non-invasive plants were decreased by nitrogen treatment (Fig. 4c). The invasive plant had higher LNC but lower C:N than the other two species (Fig. 4b and c).
